page.title: 17Local History
page.content: Howgill Castle C13 with a magnificent S.W view,is defended by a natural gill and deep ravine on the N.W.The building has been much modified.The N. wall of the central block remains 10'6" thick.Barns,byres & wagon shed a steam threshing barn with saw mill has an undershot waterwheel still in use.East Gate house & cottage, Milburn House with surroundings & Farmhouse with byre, gin gang, L shaped coach house & stables are all C18.Netherley House mid C19. Crossfell Cottage 1753.Sunny Mount & Garth Cottage C18. The barn S.E. of Garth Cottage late C19.1 Roman Road from Lownthwaite Bridge-Yard of Underwood Farm-up rise to Newbiggin Road End-Hale Grange Road to Roman Camp site at Kirkby Thore. The 2nd road possibly Lownthwaite Bridge-Long Marton-Appleby?. .
